title: Ironically flaming my friends got me suspended, what to do?
body: I've just filed for a support ticket thing before writing this, just waiting for an answer but better to get this clear first, is there a way to lift my 14-day suspension or just change it to a chat ban instead? I was saying profanity but it was towards my real-life friends and premades, which they were ironically into it as well. The one who reported me was also into it for a bit, but I guess he didn't think that I'd actually get banned.

replies.body: Funny thing about that, the enemy were also in on it, we surrendered after immediately taking their nexus, and had a good laugh. I'd suspect the enemy reporting me just because, and that's only partially of the context.

>  we surrendered after immediately taking their nexus

Wait, what.

I must know how this works.

Either way, someone found it less than funny. That is why it is not allowed even if you think everyone is "in on it".

Yes, so if you were about to take the enemy nexus, you have to bring out the surrender thing on the side. Everyone surrenders (it has a delay) and you last-hit the enemy nexus. The camera would hover for a second on their nexus before rushing back to the team, saying that you lose. A pretty fun way, actually. Did it last Christmas, where you would give free wins in ranked with your friends and say "Merry Christmas" afterwards.

And yes, I'd completely understand if they would report me for actual disgust to what I said, I'm just hoping for a chat restriction instead of a 14-day ban. (don't really care if it's permanent chat ban, I just use the chat for bantering with friends anyways)
so wait...you were playing in a group of 4, intentionally lost the game at the end, and you're wondering why the random guy reported you?
Ah yes, which I should've mentioned that he was also (presumably, wouldn't know his actual feelings) in on it, since we did just run around not doing as much.
maybe he was cool with dicking around bc he figured the game was won, and when you threw it, he reported you

Yes, but then it would mention about that in the report thing, but mentioned the things I said (which I can totally agree was disgusting things I said that the bot picked up, even if it was between friends)
i mean you kind of admitted to throwing and toxic chat, not much wiggle room here

Unless you can get each person exposed to the chat (your friends, strangers, opponents if in All chat) to submit a ticket on your behalf, the report and resulting punishment will likely stick.

I recommend keeping the friendly team banter that could be offensive and distracting to outsiders, in a third party chat (like Discord).

Hm, I'm not sure since I hardly knew them.. I'll try to get into contact with them, I guess. But I totally agree with you, some of the enemy might have not liked the profanity used, which I can completely understand. Not sure how I will do this, though. Never had a penalty before, and went to straight 14-day suspension. I hope the support with hear my side as well ^^'

What exactly did you say?

The player penalty system is mainly moderated by an AI. Typing any form of hate/offensive speech, even in the context of a joke can get you banned. The AI doesn't have a sense of humor, it only sees the words you type. 

Edit: I would also recommend keeping any overly vulgar banter out of the in-game chats.

Yes, I guess you're right with that. Though I hope that a person will review and change it to a chat restriction instead, I wouldn't mind getting permanently chat banned, since I'd mostly just use it for fun banter between friends or someone I know.
Why be toxic in chat  with premades use discord or something. Riot wont ban you if you use discord but if you use there chat you follow there rules.
unironically, that's not how irony works.

If I were in your situation, I would just wait out your suspension. Riot has a reason for suspending people when they use profanity. If your friends aren't being temporarily suspended too, that's on Riots part. Once your suspension is lifted, make sure to never use profanity again.

I guess, just hope that they would change it to a chat restriction, instead.. The words I used were definitely wrong, but I feel like if it was between friends whilst the enemy was in on it shouldn't be such a harsh punishment.
Let's get dem chat logs boi
Not sure, how do I do that? I've been trying to find a way, but failing miserably :/

You accept the ban and move on

If you were using toxic language in the chat, you deserve the ban

Then everyone would be banned, wouldn't they? I still think context should be at least be heard before immediately going into a 14-day suspension, I've never even been penalized. That was my first penalty ever, and would be great if I'd at least get a chat restriction instead of going to immediate ban when it was between friends.

> [{quoted}](name=ArcadeRice,realm=EUW,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=Ejro9Q12,comment-id=00050000,timestamp=2018-12-16T01:30:20.827+0000)
>
> Then everyone would be banned, wouldn't they? I still think context should be at least be heard before immediately going into a 14-day suspension, I've never even been penalized. That was my first penalty ever, and would be great if I'd at least get a chat restriction instead of going to immediate ban when it was between friends.

How is the banning bot supposed to know the context etc?
You most likely used zero tolerance words -that should never be used- and got banned for it

Yes, which is why the discussion was created in the first place, I wanted to know if the support (from an actual person afterwards, which you can request if the bot didn't give a good answer/response) they would lift or change it to a chat restriction instead. As I said, I've never gotten a penalty before, and feel like it's harsh to get a 14-day ban without the context of friends bantering with each other. Would one of the support (not the bot) recognize it and try to change/respond or would they ignore because it's not enough reason.

I still feel like it's extreme from a simple banter even between enemies, since they had great fun with us (presumably, of course. Just lots of "xD"'s and emotes flying around). Although if the enemy were to be disturbed by what I said, then I'll understand and move on. But I feel like it's injust if they only reported me for fun which actually got me a suspension.

real friends don't report you for flaming, they flame you right back.

Delete that guy from your life.

Well, should get more context, it was the enemy team  who reported me, my friend was pretending to be a victim before we started to ironically make fun of each other, they listened in and went in on it by some of the enemy dancing with us we finished the game by surrendering last second before winning, had a good laugh and then the enemy reported me presumably because they wanted for the fun of it.
